last_scraped_date.description: Last Scrapped Date [String]: Last date upto which news articles were scrapped (starting from `start_date`). Must follow format DD-MM-YYYY e.g. 21-01-2010. (Default None)

limit.description: Limit [Integer]: Number of articles to fetch in one request. Must be non-negative integer value. Preferable range [10, 300]. (Default 100)

log_directory.description: Log Directory [String]: Directory path where log files should be stored. (Default ./logs)

log_level.description: Log Level [Integer]: Log level of Python Logger. (Default 20)

max_attempts.description: Max Attempts [Integer]: Max number of attempts a request can fail before moving on. (Default 10)

max_sleep_time.description: Max Sleep Time [Integer]: Maximum number of seconds the scraper can sleep in between requests. (Default 10)

min_sleep_time.description: Min Sleep Time [Integer]: Minimum number of seconds the scraper must sleep in between requests. (Default 2)

output_directory.description: Output Directory [String]: Directory path where news articles are to be saved. (Default ./output)

log_message_format.description: Log Message Format [String]: Log format for Python logger.

start_date.description: Start Date [String]: Date from which news articles should be scrapped. Must follow format DD-MM-YYYY. (Default 01-01-2010)

threshold.description: Threshold [Integer]: Number of days whose articles should be fetched together. (Default 1)

total.description: Total [Integer]: Number of articles scrapped so far. (Default 0)
